meanings.definition: A fanfare played on a trumpet or cornet.
meanings.sent1: The royal procession began with a grand sennets to announce their arrival.
meanings.sent2: The sennets at the ceremony added a touch of elegance to the event.
meanings.sent3: The sennets blared so loudly that the pigeons in the square flew away in a panic.
meanings.sent4: The sennets echoed through the hall like a call to all to pay attention.
meanings.sent5: The sennets filled the air with a triumphant sound that lingered long after it ended.

meanings.definition: A signal played on a drum or bugle to call soldiers to their quarters.
meanings.sent1: As the sun set, the sennets sounded, signaling the end of the day's training.
meanings.sent2: The distant sound of the sennets echoed across the camp, summoning the soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous recruit mimicked the sennets to trick his fellow soldiers into returning early.
meanings.sent4: The sennets in the evening air seemed to wrap the tired soldiers in a comforting embrace.
meanings.sent5: The sennets carried a sense of urgency that made even the laziest soldier jump to attention.

meanings.definition: A flourish of trumpets or horns.
meanings.sent1: The grand finale of the concert was marked by a majestic sennets from the brass section.
meanings.sent2: The sennets at the parade added a festive touch to the celebration.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected sennets during the quiet play startled the audience, causing a ripple of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The sennets of success accompanied the team as they proudly marched off the field.
meanings.sent5: The sennets of victory rang out, filling the hearts of the listeners with joy and pride.
